availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Haebe (Henderson County, Kentucky, merchant and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, resident and private (U.S.A.). Native of Germany. Son of Mary Haebe and Lewis Haebe. Married Mary J Pecon Haebe in Henderson County, Kentucky in December 1853. Father of Lucy F Haebe, Sarah E. Haebe, and Charles T. Haebe. Laborer in Newburgh, Warrick County, Indiana in 1850. Merchant in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Ninth Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from May 27, 1861 to June 7, 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Warrick County, Newburgh, p. 256. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 210. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 000576460, p. 75.Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 181. Constantin Grebner, ”We Were The Ninth:” A History of the Ninth Regiment, Ohio Volunteer Infantry, April 17, 1861, to June 7, 1864”, trans. Frederic Trautmann, (Kent, OH: The Kent State University Press, 1987), 135, 204.
